# UIHoverEffect

**Protocol**

A hover effect that can apply to a view through a hover style.

## Declaration

```swift
protocol UIHoverEffect
```

## Overview

You don’t conform to this protocol directly. Instead, you use a built-in [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIHoverEffect-40091] like [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIHoverAutomaticEffect-swift.struct].

## Choosing a hover effect

- **automatic**: A system-default hover effect that automatically selects the appropriate effect based on the view to which it applies.
- **highlight**: An effect that applies a highlight to the view on hover.
- **lift**: An effect that can visually lift the view on hover where appropriate.

## Specifying a hover effect

- **effect**: The effect to apply to the view with this style.
- **UIHoverAutomaticEffect**: A system-default hover effect that automatically selects the appropriate effect based on the view to which it applies.
- **UIHoverHighlightEffect**: An effect that applies a highlight to the view on hover.
- **UIHoverLiftEffect**: An effect that can visually lift the view on hover where appropriate.

## Conforming Types

- UIHoverAutomaticEffect
- UIHoverHighlightEffect
- UIHoverLiftEffect
- UIPointerEffect
